page.title: 03Birds of Hungerford.
page.content: The large sporting estates and extensive ares of open common land round Hungerford _ together with the Canal, Rivers Kennet and Dun and their small tributaries wandering across the valley provide excellent habitat for birds of both Wetland and Farmland species. Little Grebe,Mallard Tufted Duck, Mute Swan, Canada Goose, Coot and Moorhen are seen all the year on the waterways. Herons regularly feed at the Berks Trout Farm and at least 6 pairs of Kingfishers breed locally. In the reed beds and marshes high numbers of summer migrants, such as Reed and Sedge Warblers and occasionally Grasshopper Warblers together with resident Reed Buntings breed. The House Martin colony at the Primary school has about 30 pairs but is now in decline. Barn Owls are not now often seen in the area.
